questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters uses Marketing Cloud Connect to leverage Sales Cloud data in their Journeys. A user recently reported the data coming from Sales Cloud is NOT up to date.
Where should the Marketing Cloud admin begin troubleshooting?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The path is Contact Builder>Data Sources>Synchronized Data Sources. Therefore, I selected B as the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
Troubleshooting starts in the configuration of the synced data sources, which is done in Contact Builder > Data Sources
I think it is "synchronized data sources" and "Salesforce Data Extensions". I don't think "synchronized data extensions" is a term used. So I think the answer is "B"

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters has a mobile app.
Which product would allow them to send push notifications to customers with their mobile app?

discussion.content: C is the answer

Selected Answer: C
C is correct because "Group connect" is used for sending messages using connected messaging applications such as Line and Facebook messenger. The ideal option would be "Mobile Push", but as you trigger the mobile push notifications on your Journey, using Journey builder, the most suitable answer in this case is C

Selected Answer: C
Journey Builder is the correct answer, as Group Connect is specific for sending messages via LINE or Facebook Messanger

Selected Answer: C
Journey Builder. If Mobile Push was an option that would be true as well.
SORRY JOURNEY BUILDER

Selected Answer: C
Journey builder is the answer (if mobile push is not available)

Selected Answer: B
It is a better fit

Selected Answer: C
Explanation:
Explanation:
Journey Builder and Mobile Push are two products that would allow them to send push notifications to customers with their mobile app. Journey Builder is a product that allows marketers to create and execute cross-channel customer journeys based on events, activities, and goals. Journey Builder can be used to send push notifications to mobile app users as part of a journey. Mobile Push is a product that allows marketers to create, manage, and deliver push notifications to mobile app users. Mobile Push can be used to send push notifications as standalone messages or as part of a journey

Selected Answer: C
Journey Builder allows you to send push notifications (https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_mp_use_mobilepush_with_journey_builder.htm&type=5)
Group connect is to send messages via LINE or other apps. Content builder is for content like, images etc.

Selected Answer: B
Group Connect is designed for sending push notifications and SMS messages to specific groups of customers, which can include users of a mobile app. It is commonly used for mobile marketing and customer engagement.

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer

Selected Answer: B
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_gc_groupconnect.htm&type=5
definitely C
Or MobilePush if it's listed as an option
Should be C. Journey Builder
That's true. C should be the answer.

questions.question_text:
A Marketing Cloud admin is tasked with requesting Marketing Cloud Connect Multi-Org enablement.
What consideration should be given to the preference/profile centers for this integration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
What Are the Benefits of Multi-Org?
Multi-Org connects multiple Salesforce orgs to a single Enterprise 2.0 account, with all the Enterprise 2.0 account benefits. Your Sales or Service Cloud connections are managed at the Business Unit level. Multi-Org is a great solution to centralize your marketing content in Engagement, but maintain separate CRM data throughout your organization.

A is correct:
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_co_faqs_for_multi_org.htm&type=5
Is the Standard Profile Center Supported in Multi-Org?
No. Custom Profile Centers are required for Multi-Org.

choices.B: Branding for each business unitsâ€™ profile centers will be inherited from the default business unit setup.
choices.A: Multi-Org does not support the standard profile/preference center for the business units.
choices.C: Profile/preference centers are automatically created for each business unit connected through Multi-Org.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"testable" is not needed in this case. It would also allow sending, but primarily the "sendable" must be selected

questions.question_text:
Northern Outfitters is preparing to send a promotional email. The audience file was loaded into a data extension but it does not display for the Marketing Cloud admin scheduling the send.
What should the admin confirm to resolve the issue?

choices.B: The data extension is linked using the Contact Key.
choices.C: The data extension is marked as Sendable.
choices.A: The data extension is marked as Sendable and Testable

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to send a custom survey to customers asking about their experience following a recent purchase.
Which feature should be used to create a survey form?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Smart Capture
